title: Purpose and objectives
Scope and applicability
body_md:
This policy applies to all employees, contractors, and associated persons acting on behalf of {{firm.name}}, including agents, introducers, and distributors.

It applies across all business lines and jurisdictions in which the firm operates.

title: What is a bribe
body_md:
A bribe is a financial or other advantage offered, promised, given, requested, or accepted with the intention of inducing or rewarding improper performance.

Improper performance includes breaches of duty, dishonesty, or misuse of position.

title: UK bribery offences
body_md:
The UK Bribery Act includes offences for bribing another person, being bribed, bribing a foreign public official, and the corporate offence of failure to prevent bribery (section 7).

{{firm.name}} may be liable if an associated person bribes on its behalf unless adequate procedures are in place.

title: Six prevention principles
body_md:
{{firm.name}} applies the Ministry of Justice six principles: proportionate procedures, top-level commitment, risk assessment, due diligence, communication and training, and monitoring and review.

Controls must be proportionate to risk and documented.

title: Gifts, hospitality, and donations
Third-party and introducer risk
Facilitation payments
body_md: Facilitation payments, even if small or customary in another jurisdiction, are prohibited. Staff must refuse and escalate any request for such payments.

title: Books and records
body_md:
All transactions must be accurately described and supported by approvals, invoices, and deliverables. Registers for gifts and hospitality must be complete and reviewed.

If it is not recorded, it did not happen.

title: Escalation and speak-up
body_md: If something feels improper, pause and escalate via line management, Compliance, or the whistleblowing channel. Retaliation is not tolerated, and all concerns must be documented.

title: Training and awareness
body_md: All staff must complete anti-bribery training relevant to their role. Training completion and attestations must be recorded and refreshed in line with the firm training plan.

title: Governance and review
body_md: Compliance oversees the ABC framework. Senior management sets the tone from the top, reviews risk assessments, and ensures proportionate resources and monitoring.
